sentence.Network_cn: 把没种庄稼和植物的土地都深翻一遍。

sentence.Network_cn: 牙医开始在那颗有问题的牙齿上挖洞，钻孔，直到最后把它补好。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: perhaps from Old English dīc 'ditch'

encyclopedia.content: 英语中的dig dig 及物动词 vt. ⒈ 掘（土）；挖（洞，沟等） They are digging a tunnel through the hill. 他们正在挖一条贯通这座山的隧道。 ⒉ 掘取 They dug worms for bait. 他们掘蚯蚓做钓饵。 ⒊ 发掘，探究 ⒋ 戳，刺，碰；将。..戳进[O] ⒌ 【俚】懂；喜欢 I dig rock and roll music. 我欣赏摇滚乐。 Do you dig what I mean? 你懂我的意思吗？ 不及物动词 vi. ⒈ 挖掘，发掘 This animal can dig faster than any cat

entry.def: If people or animals dig, they make a hole in the ground or in a pile of earth, stones, or rubbish.

example.ex: They tried digging in a patch just below the cave...
example.tran: 他们试着在洞穴正下方的一块地上挖掘。

example.ex: Dig a largish hole and bang the stake in first...
example.tran: 挖一个大点儿的洞，先把木桩敲进去。

entry.def: If you dig into something such as a deep container, you put your hand in it to search for something.

example.ex: He dug into his coat pocket for his keys.
example.tran: 他把手伸进上衣口袋里摸钥匙。

entry.def: If you dig one thing into another or if one thing digs into another, the first thing is pushed hard into the second, or presses hard into it.

example.ex: She digs the serving spoon into the moussaka...
example.tran: 她把分菜匙伸进那盘碎肉茄子蛋中。

example.ex: I grab George's arm and dig my nails into his flesh...
example.tran: 我抓住乔治的胳膊，指甲抠进了他的肉里。

entry.def: If you dig into a subject or a store of information, you study it very carefully in order to discover or check facts.

example.ex: The enquiry dug deeper into the alleged financial misdeeds of his government...
example.tran: 这一调查对其政府涉嫌的财政违规行为展开了进一步深究。

example.ex: He has been digging into the local archives...
example.tran: 他一直在仔细查阅当地的档案资料。

entry.tran: (尤指从自己造成的困境或令人不快的情形中)脱（身）
entry.def: If you dig yourself out of a difficult or unpleasant situation, especially one which you caused yourself, you manage to get out of it.

example.ex: Occupants of the White House have exploited their office at key moments in an election campaign to dig themselves out of trouble...
example.tran: 在竞选活动的关键时刻，白宫的主人利用职权帮助自己摆脱了麻烦。

example.ex: He's taken these measures to try and dig himself out of a hole.
example.tran: 他已采取了这些措施，试图让自己摆脱困境。

entry.def: If you say that you dig something, you mean that you like it and understand it.

example.ex: 'They play classic rock'n'roll,' states her boyfriend, 'My dad digs them too.'...
example.tran: “他们演奏经典摇滚乐，”她的男朋友说道，“我爸爸也喜欢他们。”

example.ex: I can dig it. I don't expect a band always to be innovative.
example.tran: 我可以理解。我不指望一个乐队总能创新。

entry.def: A dig is an organized activity in which people dig into the ground in order to discover ancient historical objects.

example.ex: He's an archaeologist and has been on a dig in Crete for the past year.
example.tran: 他是位考古学家，过去的一年都在参与克里特岛上的一项考古发掘工作。

entry.def: If you have a dig at someone, you say something which is intended to make fun of them or upset them.

example.ex: Americans are always quick to have a dig at the British...
example.tran: 美国人总是动不动就嘲讽英国人。

example.ex: She couldn't resist a dig at Dave after his unfortunate performance.
example.tran: 戴夫糟糕的表演结束后，她忍不住想挖苦他一番。

entry.def: If you give someone a dig in a part of their body, you push them with your finger or your elbow, usually as a warning or as a joke.

example.ex: Cassandra silenced him with a sharp dig in the small of the back.
example.tran: 卡桑德拉使劲戳了一下他的后腰，让他住嘴。

entry.def: If you live in digs, you live in a room in someone else's house and pay them rent.

example.ex: He went to London and lived in digs in Gloucester Road...
example.tran: 他去了伦敦，在格洛斯特路的一所房子里租了房间住。

entry.def: If you dig deep, you do a very thorough investigation into something.

example.ex: I want you to dig deep. Find out who she is, and where she came from.
example.tran: 我想让你彻底调查一下，弄清她是谁，从哪里来的。

entry.def: If someone digs into their pocket or digs into their purse, they manage after some difficulty to find the money to pay for something.

example.ex: Holidaymakers are digging deep into their pockets to book late summer breaks.
example.tran: 度假者想方设法拿出钱来预订夏末的短暂假期。

means.word_mean: 1. the site of an archeological exploration;

sentences.sentence: "they set up camp next to the dig"

means.word_mean: 2. an aggressive remark directed at a person like a missile and intended to have a telling effect;

sentences.sentence: "she takes a dig at me every chance she gets"

means.word_mean: 3. a small gouge (as in the cover of a book);

sentences.sentence: "the book was in good condition except for a dig in the back cover"
"there's an interesting excavation going on near Princeton"

means.word_mean: 5. the act of touching someone suddenly with your finger or elbow;

sentences.sentence: "she gave me a sharp dig in the ribs"

means.word_mean: 1. turn up, loosen, or remove earth;

sentences.sentence: "She was digging away at her math homework"

means.word_mean: 4. remove the inner part or the core of;

sentences.sentence: "the mining company wants to excavate the hillsite"
"he jabbed his finger into her ribs"
"Do you comprehend the meaning of this letter?"

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Dig deeper in your research befor posting your opinion.

auth_sentence.res_content: His outdoor installation is based on an archaeological dig.

auth_sentence.content: To dig a borehole is to create a community.
auth_sentence.res_content: To dig a borehole is to create a community.

Sentence.sentence: Each member volunteered to clean up and to dig in plot, five flats of flowers.

But schools rarely dig down to find out what really makes an applicant succeed, to create a class which also contains diversity of attitude and approach – arguably the only diversity that, in a business context, really matters.

sentences.en: She went from place to place, and dug and weeded.
sentences.cn: 她到处走, 又挖土, 又锄草。

means.word_mean: 中意, 了解, 欣赏

sentences.en: I really dig the way she sings.

means.word_mean: 用…刺戳；以…触碰；触，碰；刺戳；插入(常与 in into 连用)

sentences.en: She dug her heel into the ground.
The horse started galloping the moment I gave it a good dig.
sentences.cn: 我猛戳了马一下, 它就奔驰起来了。

sentences.en: She makes mean little digs at him.
sentences.cn: 她冲他说一些刻薄的挖苦话。

means.word_mean: 掘进，挖进，挖入，开凿(隧道等)；掘进似的费劲前进(through，into，under)

sentences.en: They dug through the mountain to build a tunnel.
sentences.cn: 他们掘穿大山筑一条隧道。

jushi.chinese: 挖到深处,我们找到了水。

jushi.english: The negotiators have been instructed to dig in their toes on the last two major issues.
jushi.chinese: 谈判代表受命坚定自己的立场在两大问题上寸步不让。

jushi.english: She went from place to place, and dug and weeded.
jushi.chinese: 她到处走,又挖土,又锄草。
